SpecialAbility.Name: Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Aleena are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mood Indicator
SpecialAbility.Description: If an Anx's head-crest is not covered, the character upgrades the difficulty of Deception checks once.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Breathing
SpecialAbility.Description: All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Environmental Conditions
SpecialAbility.Description: Aquala may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to any cold or wet conditions.

Option.Name: Survival
Option.Description: Ualaq may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

Option.Name: Perception
Option.Description: Ualaq may begin the game with one rank in Perception.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Breathing
SpecialAbility.Description: All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Environmental Conditions
SpecialAbility.Description: Ualaq may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to dark conditions, but suffer [SETBACK] to Perception checks in brightly lit environments

Option.Name: Athletics
Option.Description: Quara may begin the game with one rank in Athletics.

Option.Name: Coercion
Option.Description: Quara may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

SpecialAbility.Name: Underwater Breathing
SpecialAbility.Description: All Aqualish are capable of breathing underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Environmental Conditions
SpecialAbility.Description: Quara may remove [SETBACK] when attempting to track anything through a natural environment.

SpecialAbility.Name: Environment
SpecialAbility.Description: Arcona may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mood Readers
SpecialAbility.Description: Arcona add [ADVANTAGE] to any Charm or Negotiation checks they make.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Genetically Engineered
SpecialAbility.Description: Arkanian Offshoots may choose to suffer one Strain to receive a [BOOST] to a single Brawn or Agility-based check made on their turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Intellectual
SpecialAbility.Description: Arkanians receive a [BOOST] when making all knowledge skill checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: May use claws when brawling
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Barabel makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +1 point of damage and has a Crit Rating of 3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resists Radiation
SpecialAbility.Description: Barabels may add [BOOST] to Resilience checks made to resist the effects of radiation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resists Stun
SpecialAbility.Description: Barabels may reduce the Strain damage suffered from Stun attacks by two.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Limbs
SpecialAbility.Description: Besalisks have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Option.Name: One Rank in Charm
Option.Description: Caamasi may begin the game with one rank in Charm.

Option.Name: One Rank in Discipline
Option.Description: Caamasi may begin the game with one rank in Discipline.

SpecialAbility.Name: Memnii
SpecialAbility.Description: Once per game session, a Caamasi may form a new memnis that encompasses one scene or encounter. At any time, a Caamasi may perfectly recall any memnis that he has formed or witnessed, or share it with another Caamasi or Force-sensitive.

Option.Name: One Rank in Athletics
Option.Description: Cathar may begin the game with one rank in Athletics.

Option.Name: One Rank in Stealth
Option.Description: Cathar may begin the game with one rank in Stealth.

SpecialAbility.Name: May use claws when brawling
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Cathar makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +1 point of damage and has a Crit Rating of 3.

Skill.Special: All Knowledge Skills as Career Skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Acute Senses
SpecialAbility.Description: Chandra-Fan remove up to [REMSETBACK][REMSETBACK] from Perception checks due to superior senses.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Chadra-Fan have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Chagrians can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Advanced Olfaction
SpecialAbility.Description: Chevin add [BOOST] to Perception checks involving the sense of smell.

SpecialAbility.Name: Infravision
SpecialAbility.Description: Chiss have adapted to be able to see in both the infrared and normal visual spectra. This enables Chiss characters to remove up to [SETBACK] added to checks by lighting conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Changeling
SpecialAbility.Description: As an action, may suffer 3 strain and make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] to change appearance to match a previously-observed silhouette 1 character. Observer must make an opposed [B]Perception vs. Deception check[b] to detect that something is amiss.

Option.Name: Piloting - Planetary
Option.Description: May begin game with one rank in Piloting - Planetary.

Option.Name: Piloting - Space
Option.Description: May begin game with one rank in Piloting - Space.

Option.Name: One Rank in Coercion
Option.Description: Dashade may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Option.Name: One Rank in Vigilance
Option.Description: Dashade may begin the game with one rank in Vigilance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Force Resistance
SpecialAbility.Description: Upgrade the difficulty of Discipline checks to affect a Dashade with a Force power or talent by one.

SpecialAbility.Name: Light Sensitive
SpecialAbility.Description: In bright light, without protective goggles, Defel suffer [SETBACK][SETBACK] on all skill checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Shadowed
SpecialAbility.Description: In darkness, Defel gain [BOOST][BOOST] to Stealth checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Defel have a Silhouette of 0.

Option.Name: One Rank in Deception
Option.Description: Devaronian may begin the game with one rank in Deception.

Option.Name: One Rank in Survival
Option.Description: Devaronian may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

SpecialAbility.Name: Resillient Metabolism
SpecialAbility.Description: Devaronians add automatic [SU] to all Resillience checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Skilled Assistance
SpecialAbility.Description: Drall add [BOOST] when providing skilled assistance.

Option.Name: Primitive
Option.Description: Dressellians must upgrade the difficulty of any checks involving non-Dressellian technology.

Option.Name: Non-Primitive
Option.Description: Tech-saavy Dressellians do not need to upgrade the difficulty of checks involving non-Dressellian technology.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Feature
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Inorganic
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mechanical Being
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cybernetics
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids have a cybernetics implant cap of 6.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Feature
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Inorganic
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mechanical Being
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cybernetics
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids have a cybernetics implant cap of 6.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Inorganic
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mechanical Being
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cybernetics
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids have a cybernetics implant cap of 6.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Feature
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Inorganic
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

SpecialAbility.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: May train in two additional career skills and one additional specialization skills

SpecialAbility.Name: Feature
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breath, and are unaffected by vacuum, toxins, and poisons.

SpecialAbility.Name: Inorganic
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids do not gain benefits from bacta, stimpacks, or Medicine checks. They must be repaired with repair patches and Mechanics checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mechanical Being
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids cannot become Force sensitive, cannot acquire a Force Rating or Force powers, and are not affected by mind-altering Force powers.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cybernetics
SpecialAbility.Description: Droids have a cybernetics implant cap of 6.

SpecialAbility.Name: Intuitive Navigation
SpecialAbility.Description: Add [ADVANTAGE] to all Astrogation checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Digging Claws
SpecialAbility.Description: Elom may use a move maneuver to travel through loose soil or similar terrain. Can result in low, narrow tunnel that others can use, at GM's discretion.

Option.Name: One Rank in Stealth
Option.Description: Ewoks may begin the game with one rank in Stealth.

Option.Name: One Rank in Survival
Option.Description: Ewoks may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

SpecialAbility.Name: Heightened Smell
SpecialAbility.Description: Ewoks may remove all [SETBACK] imposed due to concealment against a target that is within Short Range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Ewoks have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Beguiling Pheromones
SpecialAbility.Description: Once per check as an incidental, may suffer 2 strain to upgrade ability of Charm, Deception, or Negotiation check against living, sentient being within short range. No effect if wearing breath mask or having no respiratory system.

Option.Name: One Rank in Deception
Option.Description: Farghul may begin the game with one rank in Deception.

Option.Name: One Rank in Skulduggery
Option.Description: Farghul may begin the game with one rank in Skulduggery.

SpecialAbility.Name: Savage Warrior
SpecialAbility.Description: When making a Brawl or Melee check, Gamorreans add the Vicious 1 quality to their weapons. If the weapon already has the Vicious quality, increase the listed value by one.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Option.Name: Has Lungs
Option.Description: Requires ammonia respirator

Option.Name: Lungless
Option.Description: Immune to suffocation

Option.Name: Coercion
Option.Description: Ganks may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Option.Name: Vigilance
Option.Description: Ganks may begin the game with one rank in Vigilance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cyborg
SpecialAbility.Description: Ganks may begin play with up to two cybernetic implants that cost up to 5,000 credits. Extra credits for obligation may be applied to purchase these cybernetics.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sealed Exoskeleton
SpecialAbility.Description: Given are immune to the effects of vacuum or suffocation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Small
SpecialAbility.Description: Gossam are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Energy Sensitivity
SpecialAbility.Description: Once per encounter as a maneuver, may sense the presence and current emotional states of all living things within short range.

Option.Name: One rank in Charm
Option.Description: Gran may take one rank in Charm

Option.Name: One rank in Negotiation
Option.Description: Gran may take one rank in Negotiation

SpecialAbility.Name: Enhanced Vision
SpecialAbility.Description: When making ranged combat or Perception checks, Gran remove up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to environmental conditions or concealment (but not defense).

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Gungans may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Non-Career Skills
SpecialAbility.Description: Humans start the game with one rank in two different non-career skills of their choice.

Option.Name: Coercion
Option.Description: Hutts may begin the game with one rank in Coercion.

Option.Name: Discipline
Option.Description: Hutts may begin the game with one rank in Discipline.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ponderous
SpecialAbility.Description: A Hutt can never spend more than one maneuver moving per turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: Precognition
SpecialAbility.Description: In addition to seeing flashes of the future at the GM's discretion, an Iktotchi may spend [TR] on an Initiative check to perform a free maneuver, or have an ally within short range perform a free maneuver, before the encounter begins.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Ishi Tib can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Water Dependence
SpecialAbility.Description: If an Ishi Tib has not been doused in salt water in the last twenty-four hours, the character's wound threshold is reduced by 2. This condition remains in effect until the ishi Tib is doused in salt water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Bellow
SpecialAbility.Description: With two mouths and four throats, Ithorians have a unique natural weapon they can call upon when threatened. Each time the Ithorian uses this ability, he suffers 3 strain..

SpecialAbility.Name: Desert Dweller
SpecialAbility.Description: Jawas may remove one [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Jawas have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dark Vision
SpecialAbility.Description: Kel Dors remove up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to darkness from any skill checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Atmospheric Requirement
SpecialAbility.Description: Kel Dors must wear a specialized mask to breath and see outside of their native atmosphere. However, Kel Dor may survive in vacuum for up to five minues before suffering its effects.

Option.Name: One Rank in Brawl
Option.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Brawl.

Option.Name: One Rank in Ranged-Heavy
Option.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Ranged-Heavy.

Option.Name: One Rank in Ranged-Light
Option.Description: Klatooninians may begin the game with one rank in Ranged-Light.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Non-Career Skill
SpecialAbility.Description: Klatooninians start the game with one additional rank of one non-career skill of his choice.

SpecialAbility.Name: Dense Musculature
SpecialAbility.Description: Once per round as a maneuver, may suffer 3 strain to leap horizontally or vertically to any location within medium range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Indomitable
SpecialAbility.Description: A Lannik removes up to [SE][SE] caused by Critical Injuries, the disoriented condition, and fear from all checks he makes.

Option.Name: Athletics
Option.Description: Lepi may begin the game with one free rank in Athletics.

Option.Name: Perception
Option.Description: Lepi may begin the game with one free rank in Perception.

Option.Name: Combat Skill
Option.Description: Mandalorian Humans start the game with one rank in a combat skill of their choice.

Option.Name: Knowledge Skills
Option.Description: Mandalorian Humans start the game with one rank in two knowledge skills of their choice.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Mon Calamari can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
SpecialAbility.Description: Northern Mustafarians may remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] to resist arid or hot environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
SpecialAbility.Description: Southern Mustafarians may remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] to resist arid or hot environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Deep Pockets
SpecialAbility.Description: Muun characters start the game with an additional 1,000 credits. They may not be spend during character creation.

Option.Name: Charm
Option.Description: Nagai may begin the game with one free rank in Charm.

Option.Name: Coordination
Option.Description: Nagai may begin the game with one free rank in Coordination

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Nautolans may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

Option.Name: Negotiation
Option.Description: Neimoidians may begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

Option.Name: Deception
Option.Description: Neimoidians may begin the game with one free rank in Deception.

SpecialAbility.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
SpecialAbility.Description: Red Niktos may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot enviromental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: May use claws when brawling
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Green Nikto makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, he deals +1 damage and has a Critical Rating of 3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Climbing
SpecialAbility.Description: Green Nikto gain [BOOST] to Athletics checks made to climb trees and other surfaces their claws can pierce.

SpecialAbility.Name: Swimmer
SpecialAbility.Description: A Pale Nikto never suffers movement penalties for traveling through water and can hold his breath for a number of rounds equal to twice his Brawn rating before beginning to drown.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sounds
SpecialAbility.Description: Southern Nikto may add [BOOST] to Perception and Vigilance checks to detect sounds.

SpecialAbility.Name: Concealment
SpecialAbility.Description: Noghri may remove all [SETBACK] imposed due to concealment against a target that is within Short Range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Claws and Teeth
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Noghri makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +1 point of damage and has a Crit Rating of 3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Intestinal Fortitude
SpecialAbility.Description: Ortolans downgrade the difficulty of Resilience checks made to resist the effects of any poison by one.

SpecialAbility.Name: Keen Senses
SpecialAbility.Description: Ortolans receive a [BOOST] on Perception checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Ortolans have a Silhouette of 0.

Option.Name: Cool
Option.Description: Pantorans may begin the game with one rank in Cool.

Option.Name: Negotiation
Option.Description: Pantorans may begin the game with one rank in Negotiation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tundra Dweller
SpecialAbility.Description: When making skill checks, Pantorans may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to cold environmental conditions.

Option.Name: Coercion
Option.Description: Pau'ans may begin the game with one free rank in Coercion.

Option.Name: Negotiation
Option.Description: Pau'an may begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

Option.Name: No Vocal Chords
Option.Description: A vast majority of Polis Massans are born without vocal chords.

Option.Name: Posesses Vocal Chords
Option.Description: A small minority of Polis Massans do possess vocal chords. Referred to as "speakers" by their people, these rare individuals can physically speak languages, though their voices are soft and strangely resonant.

SpecialAbility.Name: Telepathy
SpecialAbility.Description: Polis Massans can communicate with other beings using a simple form of telepathy. At short range, this is akin to a broadcast, and any being will "hear" what the Polis Massan says. They can "whisper" to individuals at engaged range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious
SpecialAbility.Description: Can breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Ink Spray
SpecialAbility.Description: Can spray ink. Once per encounter, as an out-of-turn incidental, may suffer 2 strain to add [SE] to enemy check within short range. Add [SE][SE][SE] underwater.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Limbs
SpecialAbility.Description: Quermians have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Option.Name: Deception
Option.Description: Ryn may begin the game with one free rank in Deception.

Option.Name: Streetwise
Option.Description: Ryn may begin the game with one free rank in Streetwise.

SpecialAbility.Name: Prehensile Tail
SpecialAbility.Description: Ryn can use their tails to hold and manipulate small items, but cannot use that item to make an attack.

Option.Name: Perception
Option.Description: Sakiyans may begin the game with one rank in Perception.

Option.Name: Vigilance
Option.Description: Sakiyans may begin the game with one rank in Vigilance.

SpecialAbility.Name: Glider
SpecialAbility.Description: A Sathari can fall safely from any height and can glide over small gaps or distances while falling. While conscious, a Sathari character does not suffer damage from falling (see page 221 of the [B]Force and Destiny[b] Core Rulebook).

Option.Name: Medicine
Option.Description: Selkaths may begin the game with one free rank in Medicine.

Option.Name: Negotiation
Option.Description: Selkaths begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Amphibious:
SpecialAbility.Description: Selkaths may breathe underwater without penalty and never suffer movement penalties for traveling through water.

SpecialAbility.Name: Sees in Darkness
SpecialAbility.Description: Selonians see in almost total darkness. Remove all [SETBACK] added due to darkness.

Option.Name: Brawl
Option.Description: Shistavanens may begin the game with one rank in Brawl.

Option.Name: Survival
Option.Description: Shistavanens may begin the game with one rank in Survival.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hunter's Instincts
SpecialAbility.Description: When making an Initiative check, a Shistavanens may use Survival instead of Vigilance or Cool.

Option.Name: Gearhead
Option.Description: Sluissi may begin play with one rank in Gearhead.

Option.Name: Solid Repairs
Option.Description: Sluissi may begin play with one rank in Solid Repairs.

SpecialAbility.Name: Practiced Mechanic
SpecialAbility.Description: A Sluissi can choose to spend a maneuver just prior to making a Mechanics roll, upgrading the dice pool by one.

Option.Name: Charm
Option.Description: Snivvian may begin the game with one free rank in Charm.

Option.Name: Perception
Option.Description: Snivvian may begin the game with one free rank in Perception.

SpecialAbility.Name: Cold Resistance
SpecialAbility.Description: When making skill checks, Snivvians may remove [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to cold environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Snivvians have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Mechanics
SpecialAbility.Description: Squibs always treat Mechanics as being a career skill, regardless of their starting career.

SpecialAbility.Name: Reduced Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Squibs have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Insulated fur
SpecialAbility.Description: When making skill checks, Talz remove [SETBACK] imposed due to actic or cold environmental conditions.

SpecialAbility.Name: Multiple Personalities
SpecialAbility.Description: At the start of their turn, Thakwaash can choose to suffer 2 strain to upgrade the dice pool once for a specific skill until the start of their next turn.

SpecialAbility.Name: May use claws when brawling
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Togorian makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +1 point of damage and has a Crit Rating of 3.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pack Instincts
SpecialAbility.Description: When performing the assist maneuver, Togrutas grant [BOOST][BOOST] instead of [BOOST].

SpecialAbility.Name: Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Toydarians are smaller than average and count as silhouette 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hoverer
SpecialAbility.Description: Toydarians have wings that allow them to hover slightly off the ground. When hovering, Toydarians do not have to spend additional maneuvers when navigating difficult terrain. Otherwise, their wings allow them no extra capabilities beyond those of a normal, walking character.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Wound Regeneration
SpecialAbility.Description: Whenever a trandoshan would recover one or more wounds from natural rest or recuperation in a Bacta tank, he recovers one additional wound. Trandoshans can regrow lost limbs as well, though it usully takes at least a month before the limb is usable.

SpecialAbility.Name: May use claws when brawling
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Trandoshan makes Brawl checks to deal damage to an opponent, he deals +1 damage and has a Critical Rating of 3.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Option.Name: Charm
Option.Description: Twi'leks may begin the game with one rank in Charm.

Option.Name: Deception
Option.Description: Twi'leks may begin the game with one rank in Deception.

SpecialAbility.Name: Arid/Hot Environments
SpecialAbility.Description: When making skill checks, Twi'leks may remove [SETBACK] imposed due to arid or hot environmental conditions.

Option.Name: Perception
Option.Description: Ubese may begin the game with one free rank in Perception.

Option.Name: Survival
Option.Description: Ubese may begin the game with one free rank in Survival

Option.Name: Mechanics
Option.Description: Ugnaughts may begin the game with one free rank in Mechanics.

Option.Name: Negotiation
Option.Description: Ugnaughts may begin the game with one free rank in Negotiation.

SpecialAbility.Name: Exceptionally Hardy
SpecialAbility.Description: Ugnaughts add [ADVANTAGE] to Resilience checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Silhouette
SpecialAbility.Description: Ugnaughts have a Silhouette of 0.

SpecialAbility.Name: Microvision
SpecialAbility.Description: When closely examining an object, Verpine add [BO] to their Perception checks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Radio-wave Communication
SpecialAbility.Description: Verpine can produce and hear radio waves, which allows them to silently communicate with other Verpine and specially-tuned comlinks within a 100-kilometer range.

Option.Name: One Rank in Resilience
Option.Description: Weequay may begin the game with one rank in Resilience.

Option.Name: One Rank in Athletics
Option.Description: Weequay may begin the game with one rank in Athletics.

SpecialAbility.Name: Communicative Pheromones
SpecialAbility.Description: Weequay can communicate non-verbally with other Weequays up to Short Range.

SpecialAbility.Name: Tusks
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Whiphid makes a Brawl check to deal damage to an opponent, their attack deals +2 point of damage, has a Crit Rating of 4, and has the Vicious 1 quality.

SpecialAbility.Name: Hardy Survivalist
SpecialAbility.Description: A Whiphid adds automatic [SU] to Survival checks and can survive for several weeks without food thanks to reserve blubber.

Source.Book: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

SpecialAbility.Name: Rages when Wounded
SpecialAbility.Description: When a Wookiee has suffered any wounds, he deals +1 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks. When a Wookiee is Critically Injured, he instead deals +2 damage to Brawl and Melee attacks.

SpecialAbility.Name: Additional Limbs
SpecialAbility.Description: Xexto have four arms and gain an additional free maneuver per turn. They still may not perform more than two maneuvers per turn, however.

SpecialAbility.Name: Fearsome Countenance
SpecialAbility.Description: A Zabrak adds automatic [ADVANTAGE] to all Coercion checks he makes.

SpecialAbility.Name: Empathy
SpecialAbility.Description: Add [SETBACK] to all incoming Charm or Deception rolls that target the Zeltron.

SpecialAbility.Name: Pheromones
SpecialAbility.Description: Zeltrons add [ADVANTAGE] to all Charm, Deception, and Negotiation skill checks.
